alert.note: Alert for Adams; Wells (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 11:38AM EDT until March 28 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... Wabash River near Linn Grove affecting Wells and Adams Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River near Linn Grove. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon to late Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, The flooding of county roads begin. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EDT Friday the stage was 9.4 feet and slowly rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 11.9 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Monday evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
